required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Safety and Tolerability Study of Arformoterol Tartrate Inhalation Solution in Pediatric Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Cumulative Dose Safety and Tolerability Crossover Study of Arformoterol Tartrate Inhalation Solution and Levalbuterol Hydrochloride Inhalation Solution in Pediatric Subjects (Aged 2 to 11 Years of Age) With Asthma

brief_summary.textblock: To determine the safety and tolerability of Arformoterol Tartrate in children with asthma

detailed_description.textblock: A randomized, double-blind two-way crossover study of three cumulative doses of arformoterol (7.5 ug per nebulization) and levalbuterol (0.63 mg per nebulization) given over a one hour period, followed by a single open-label treatment day with three cumulative doses of arformoterol 15 ug in subjects 2-11 years of age with asthma. This study was previously posted by Sepracor Inc. In October 2009, Sepracor Inc. was acquired by Dainippon Sumitomo Pharma., and in October 2010, Sepracor Inc's name was changed to Sunovion Pharmaceuticals Inc.

primary_outcome.time_frame: predose, various timeframes up to 5 hours post last dose
primary_outcome.description: Heart rate measured at various timepoints: predose and timepoints after each of the three dosings. Each treatment consists of one nebulization every 30 minutes over a 60 minute treatment interval (totaling 3 cumulative dosings at 0,30 and 60 minutes).

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Predose in Mean Heart Rate
primary_outcome.time_frame: predose, various timeframes up to 5 hours post last dose
primary_outcome.description: Heart rate measured at various timepoints minus the heart rate at predose.

primary_outcome.time_frame: predose, various timeframes up to 5 hours post last dose
primary_outcome.description: Systolic blood pressure measured at various timepoints: predose and timepoints after each of the three dosings. Each treatment consists of one nebulization every 30 minutes over a 60 minute treatment interval (totaling 3 cumulative dosings at 0,30 and 60 minutes).

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Predose in Mean Systolic Blood Pressure
primary_outcome.time_frame: predose, various timeframes up to 5 hours post last dose
primary_outcome.description: Mean systolic blood pressure measured at various timepoints minus the mean systolic blood pressure at predose

primary_outcome.time_frame: predose, various timeframes up to 5 hours post last dose
primary_outcome.description: Diastolic blood pressure measured at various timepoints: predose and timepoints after each of the three dosings. Each treatment consists of one nebulization every 30 minutes over a 60 minute treatment interval (totaling 3 cumulative dosings at 0,30 and 60 minutes).

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Predose in Mean Diastolic Blood Pressure
primary_outcome.time_frame: predose, various timeframes up to 5 hours post last dose
primary_outcome.description: Mean diastolic blood pressure measured at various timepoints minus the predose diastolic blood pressure

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Predose in Mean Serum Potassium
primary_outcome.description: Change in mean serum potassium at the specified timepoint minus the predose value.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Predose in Mean Serum Glucose
primary_outcome.description: Change in mean serum glucose at the specified timepoint minus the predose value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second(FEV1)
secondary_outcome.description: Forced Expiratory Volume in one second (FEV1) is the volume of air forcibly exhaled in one second as measured by a spirometer.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Predose of Mean Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second (FEV1)
secondary_outcome.description: Forced Expiratory Volume in one second (FEV1) is the volume of air forcibly exhaled in one second as measured by a spirometer. Change in FEV1 was calculated as postdose value minus the predose value at each visit.
PEFR is the fastest rate at which air can move through the airways during a forced expiration starting with fully inflated lungs as measured by peak flow meters.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Predose in Mean Peak Expiratory Flow Rate (PEFR)
secondary_outcome.description: PEFR is the fastest rate at which air can move through the airways during a forced expiration starting with fully inflated lungs as measured by peak flow meters. Change in PEFR was calculated as postdose value minus the predose value at each visit.
If the mean plasma concentration was 'below the limit of quantification' (BLQ) which was set as <=0.5 picograms/milliliter, the value is displayed as a zero.

arm_group.description: Cross-over phase: one day active treatment with arformoterol 7.5 microgram per nebulization followed by a 7 day washout. Then a one day active treatment with levalbuterol 0.63 milligram per nebulization. Open-label phase: Following another 7 day washout, one day treatment with arformoterol 15 micrograms per nebulization.

Cross-over phase: one day active treatment with levalbuterol 0.63 milligram per nebulization followed by a 7 day washout. Then a one day active treatment with arformoterol 7.5 micrograms per nebulization. Open-label phase: Following another 7 day washout, one day treatment with arformoterol 15 micrograms per nebulization.

intervention.description: Arformoterol is given at a 7.5 ug per dosing during the cross-over phase and 15 ug per dosing during the open-label phase. Each treatment consists of one nebulization every 30 minutes over a 60 minute treatment interval (totaling 3 cumulative dosings at 0,30 and 60 minutes).

Levalbuterol is given at a 0.63 mg per dosing during the cross-over phase. Each treatment consists of one nebulization every 30 minutes over a 60 minute treatment interval (totaling 3 cumulative dosings at 0,30 and 60 minutes).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male and Female
- Between Age 2 and 11, inclusive, at the time of consent
- Weight equal to or greater than 15 Kg
- History of physician-diagnosed asthma of at least 2 years duration for children age 6 and older, and at least 1 year duration for children 5 and younger.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Female subject who is pregnant or lactating.
- Subject who has a history of hospitalization for asthma within one year, or who is scheduled for in-patient hospitalization, including elective surgery during the course of the trial.
- Subject with any history of life-threatening asthma defined as a history of asthma episodes requiring intubation, associated with hypercapnia, respiratory arrest, or hypoxic seizures.
- Subject with a history of cancer.
- Subject with hyperthyroidism, diabetes, hypertension, cardiac diseases or seizure disorders.
- Subject with a history of cigarette smoking or use of any tobacco products.

results_reference.citation: Hinkle J, Hinson J, Kerwin E, Goodwin E, Sciarappa K, Curry L, Hanrahan JP. A cumulative dose, safety and tolerability study of arformoterol in pediatric subjects with stable asthma. Pediatr Pulmonol. 2011 Aug;46(8):761-9. doi: 10.1002/ppul.21446. Epub 2011 May 16.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 86 subjects were screened: 23 subjects aged 2-5 years and 63 subjects aged 6-11 years.

group.title: ARF/LEV
group.description: Cross-over period: one day active treatment with arformoterol 7.5 microgram per nebulization followed by a 7 day washout. Then a one day active treatment with levalbuterol 0.63 milligram per nebulization. Open-label period: Following another 7 day washout, one day treatment with arformoterol 15 micrograms per nebulization.

group.title: LEV/ARF
group.description: Cross-over period: one day active treatment with levalbuterol 0.63 milligram per nebulization followed by a 7 day washout. Then a one day active treatment with arformoterol 7.5 micrograms per nebulization. Open-label period: Following another 7 day washout, one day treatment with arformoterol 15 micrograms per nebulization.

participants_list.participants: Participants were stratified by age group at randomization: ages 2-5 yrs and 6-11 years
Participants were stratified by age group at randomization: ages 2-5 yrs and 6-11 years

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Did not meet-no longer met entry criteri

participants_list.participants: 3 subjects were dosed with arformoterol 7.5 microgram in error
3 subjects were dosed with arformoterol 7.5 microgram in error

group.title: ARF/LEV
group.description: Cross-over: Participants treated with arformoterol 7.5 microgram per nebulization; 7 day washout; levalbuterol 0.63 milligram per nebulization. Open label: 7 day washout; arformoterol 15 microgram per nebulization.

group.title: LEV/ARF
group.description: Cross-over: Participants treated with levalbuterol 0.63 milligram per nebulization; 7 day washout; arformoterol 7.5 microgram per nebulization. Open label: 7 day washout; arformoterol 15 microgram per nebulization.

group.description: Values represent participant experience when treated with levalbuterol during the cross-over portion of the study

group.title: Arformoterol 7.5 Mcg

outcome.title: Mean Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second(FEV1)
outcome.description: Forced Expiratory Volume in one second (FEV1) is the volume of air forcibly exhaled in one second as measured by a spirometer.
outcome.population: Intent to treat population. Pulmonary function testing was only performed on subjects six years of age or older; there were no subjects five or younger who performed spirometry. Subject data for those who were misdosed with ARF 7.5mcg rather than ARF 15mcg in the open-label portion were excluded from these analyses.

outcome.title: Change From Predose of Mean Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second (FEV1)
outcome.description: Forced Expiratory Volume in one second (FEV1) is the volume of air forcibly exhaled in one second as measured by a spirometer. Change in FEV1 was calculated as postdose value minus the predose value at each visit.
outcome.population: Intent to treat population. Pulmonary function testing was only performed on subjects six years of age or older; there were no subjects five or younger who performed spirometry. Subject data for those who were misdosed with ARF 7.5mcg rather than ARF 15mcg in the open-label portion were excluded from these analyses

outcome.description: PEFR is the fastest rate at which air can move through the airways during a forced expiration starting with fully inflated lungs as measured by peak flow meters.

outcome.title: Plasma Concentration of (R,R) Formoterol
outcome.description: If the mean plasma concentration was 'below the limit of quantification' (BLQ) which was set as <=0.5 picograms/milliliter, the value is displayed as a zero.
outcome.population: PK population consisted of subjects who were in the intent-to-treat population and had any plasma concentration data available.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: In addition to the <60-180 day restriction above, since this is a multicenter study, 1st publication of study results shall be made with other participating study sites as a multicenter publication; provided, if a multicenter publication is not forthcoming within 24 months following completion of study at all sites, the PI shall be free to publish.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Sample size was determined outside of statistical considerations. All data recorded at/after Visit 8 for 6 subjects, misdosed with ARF 7.5mcg instead of ARF 15mcg in open-label period, were excluded from the planned efficacy, PK and safety analyses.
